summary: This document is an email chain from October 7, 2019, regarding the delivery of surveillance equipment (PTZ cameras) to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It references tracking numbers and delivery dates from November 2018, indicating a follow-up on an earlier order. The correspondence involves a Program Manager from SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions and a Communication Technician from the US Department of Justice at MCC-New York.

persons.name: Program Manager FBOP Contracts
persons.context: Employee of SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions who sent an email confirming delivery of equipment to MCC New York and provided tracking numbers.

persons.name: Communication Technician
persons.context: US Department of Justice employee at MCC-New York who forwarded an email inquiring about the delivery status of outside PTZ cameras.

connections.description: Correspondence regarding the delivery of surveillance equipment (PTZ cameras) from SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions to the US Department of Justice at MCC-New York.

events.title: Equipment Delivery to MCC New York
events.description: Most of the ordered equipment (tracking numbers provided) was delivered to MCC New York.

events.title: Email Correspondence Regarding Equipment Delivery
events.description: Email chain discussing the delivery status of PTZ cameras to MCC New York, referencing earlier 2018 deliveries.

Beltsville MD 20705 (SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions office at 12300 Kiln Ct Suite E)
keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated October 7, 2019, concerning the delivery of surveillance equipment (PTZ cameras) to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
Tracking numbers and delivery dates from November 2018 (11/23/18, 11/26/18, 11/29/18) are listed, indicating the equipment was delivered over a year prior to this correspondence.
The correspondence involves a Program Manager from SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions and a Communication Technician from the US Department of Justice at MCC-New York.
The email includes a confidentiality notice stating it may contain proprietary information of SigNet Technologies, Inc.
The context suggests this is routine administrative follow-up regarding security equipment for a federal detention facility.
